detaileddescription.para: Back to the interpreter and push object into the stack
Same as SYX_PRIM_RETURN but the process yield the control
Enter the method which contains the primitive call
Assert the number of minimum number of arguments given. Call SYX_PRIM_FAIL if assert fails
The number of primitives
Push an object into the stack
Pop an object from the stack
Peek the last object pushed into the stack
Returns the frame associated to the given context
Creates a MethodContext or BlockContext from a frame

parameterdescription.para: the OOP of the whole stack, e.g. SYX_PROCESS_STACK (aProcess). This will not be used if the frame has been detached.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the entry of a primitive at a given index
Returns the index of a primitive having a specific name
Initialize the interpreter to be ready to execute processes.
This function is called internally by Syx and should not be called from user applications.
Finalize the execution of processes and free all the memory used by the interpreter.
This function is called internally by Syx e should not be called from user applications
Swap the current context with the given one. The context must be already existing in the process stack.

simplesect.para: FALSE if the context was syx_nil

detaileddescription.para: Enters a new MethodContext or BlockContext.

simplesect.para: FALSE if the context was syx_nil

detaileddescription.para: Leaves the current frame and push an object into the returning context.

Use the stack return frame use_stack_return is specified, otherwise use the parent frame. Then sets the returned object variable of the process to the specified object. Finally swap the context with the new one. Terminate the process if no valid return frame is found.

parameterdescription.para: the object to be pushed into the returning context
TRUE to use the stack return frame, FALSE to use the parent frame

simplesect.para: FALSE if no valid return frame is found

detaileddescription.para: Calls a primitive.

parameterdescription.para: the method in which the primitive is defined

detaileddescription.para: Executes the given process and returns once the byteslice is reached, no more instructions left or yield has been requested.
Same as syx_process_execute_scheduled but does not take care about the byteslice counter, and control is not yield until the process is terminated.
